intro: Mentha arvensis f. lanceolata, commonly known as narrow-leaf field mint, is a variant of the broad-leaf field mint. It is a perennial herb characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and aromatic, slightly hairy foliage. The plant produces small, pale blue to violet flowers that bloom in whorls along the stem. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows, along stream banks, and in woodland edges. This subspecies is valued for its medicinal properties and is used in traditional herbal remedies.
